pages.text: Fauna of all shapes and sizes you may discover on your travels

pages.title: Owl
pages.text: A bird that commonly preys on rabbits and other small animals. It flies elegantly throughout dense forests, and can bestow this grace on witches.

pages.title: Raven
pages.text: A black bird common in forests. Ravens are known for their love of small shiny objects, such as gold and silver nuggets. Ravens are popular birds among witches who want to master spells.

pages.title: Snake
pages.text: A venomous reptile that feeds on small animals. This venom can also be “milked” from the snake using a Glass Bottle. Snakes are known to have a strong connection to spirits including demons, and can share this power with witches brave enough to seek this animal.

pages.title: Toad
pages.text: An amphibian common near freshwater, especially swamps, and feeds upon invertebrates. Toads are known to aid witches who wish to enhance their brews.

pages.title: Lizard
pages.text: A common reptile found everywhere from lush forests to arid lands. Lizards enjoy eating arthropods including spiders.
